H0.text: Balance is the tool a carpenter should use to measure the length of a wooden board.

H1.text: Meter stick is the tool a carpenter should use to measure the length of a wooden board.

H2.text: Thermometer is the tool a carpenter should use to measure the length of a wooden board.

H3.text: A graduated cylinder is the tool a carpenter should use to measure the length of a wooden board.

A4.text: Tape measures used for carpentry or construction often use a curved metallic ribbon that can remain stiff and straight when extended, but can also retract into a coil for convenient storage.

A5.text: A tape measure or measuring tape is a long, flexible ruler used to measure length or distance.

A6.text: The first commercialized Digital Tape Measure was released by Starrett in 1995 under the DigiTape brand.

A7.text: A metre-stick, metrestick (or meterâ€‘stick and meterstick as alternative spellings); or yardstick is either a straightedge or foldable ruler used to measure length, and is especially common in the construction industry.

A8.text: A ruler, sometimes called a rule, scale, line gauge, or metre/meter stick, is an instrument used to make length measurements.
